required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Use of Public Messaging for the Promotion of Firearm Safety to Veterans
clinical_study.official_title: Unlocking the Potential of VA Means Safety Programs: An Examination of the Use of Public Messaging for the Promotion of Firearm Safety to Veterans

brief_summary.textblock: This pilot study seeks to determine if exposure to the firearm safety public service announcement (PSA) developed by the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) is associated with changes in related beliefs and safe storage practices. Participants are randomly assigned to message exposure or control conditions. Data from this project will inform injury prevention outreach efforts targeted towards Veteran populations.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Self-reported Injury Prevention Belief
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with self-reported response to belief that "safe storage of household firearms is effective for reducing injury or death."

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Self-reported Injury Prevention Belief
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with self-reported response to belief that "safe storage of household firearms is effective for reducing injury or death."

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Self-reported Firearm Storage Behavior at Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants at baseline with self-reported safe household firearm storage (restricted to participants with self-reported firearm access)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Self-reported Firearm Storage Behavior at Exit
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants at exit with self-reported safe household firearm storage (restricted to participants with self-reported firearm access)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Exposure to firearm safety Public Service Announcement (PSA)
arm_group.description: Exposure to the firearm safety PSA (approx. 2.5 minutes long) once per week for 3 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Exposure to a mix of PSAs
arm_group.description: Exposure to a general health promotion video (approx. 2 minutes long) 1 week post-randomization followed by exposure to firearm safety PSA at 2- and 3-weeks post-randomization.
Exposure to the general health promotion video once per week for 3 weeks.

intervention.arm_group_label: Exposure to a mix of PSAs
Exposure to firearm safety Public Service Announcement (PSA)

intervention.description: Exposed to general health promotion PSA
intervention.arm_group_label: Exposure to a mix of PSAs

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Veterans of all gender/sex, race/ethnicities
- Living in United States
- Fluent in English language
- Capable of understanding the goals of the study
- Possess computer/internet access
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not a U.S. Veteran living in the United States
- Determined to be cognitively impaired
- Currently institutionalized (e.g., hospitalized; incarcerated, etc.)
- Do not possess computer/internet access

overall_official.affiliation: VA Center of Excellence for Suicide Prevention

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Self-reported Injury Prevention Belief
outcome.description: Number of participants with self-reported response to belief that "safe storage of household firearms is effective for reducing injury or death."
outcome.population: Analyses were restricted to participants that completed both baseline and exit surveys. Descriptive statistics were tabulated by frequencies and weighted percentages or mean and standard deviation, as appropriate.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
